data.enText: to make sb who is anxious, upset, etc. feel calmer

data.chText: 音乐让她稍微安静了一会儿。
data.enText: The music soothed her for a while.

data.chText: 减轻，缓解，缓和（身体某部位的紧张或疼痛）
data.enText: to make a tense or painful part of your body feel more comfortable

data.chText: 洗个热水澡，让紧张疲劳的肌肉放松一下。
data.enText: Take a warm bath to soothe tense, tired muscles.

data.chText: 让人感到安慰的嗓音；镇痛液

data.enText: ‘There's no need to worry,’ he said soothingly.
to remove a pain or an unpleasant feeling

means: 减轻，缓解，缓和(身体某部位的紧张或疼痛)

data.enText: to remove a pain or an unpleasant feeling

example: the medicine soothes the pain of the inflammation

tr: give moral or emotional strength to

value.def: If you soothe someone who is angry or upset, you make them feel calmer.

example.ex: He would take her in his arms and soothe her...
example.tran: 他会把她揽在怀中抚慰她。

example.ex: It did not take long for the central bank to soothe investors' fears.
example.tran: 中央银行很快便消除了投资者的担忧。

example.ex: Put on some nice soothing music...
example.tran: 播放一些柔和舒缓的音乐。

example.ex: His casual, relaxed manner was very soothing.
example.tran: 他随意而放松的举动让人很快便平静下来。

example.ex: 'Now don't you worry,' she said soothingly.
example.tran: “现在你就别担心了，”她的语气里充满了抚慰。

value.def: Something that soothes a part of your body where there is pain or discomfort makes the pain or discomfort less severe.

example.tran: 滋润干燥皮肤的润肤液

value.tran: 减轻，缓和(身体的痛处或不适)

example.ex: Cold tea is very soothing for burns.
example.tran: 凉的茶水非常有助于减轻烧伤灼痛。
